While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other alleged 'Laurel & Hardy cartoons.' Jeff: Creator Tom Stempel. Mutt: Only Alan Kaplan makes an effort at acting . Sometimes cut altogether from syndication.
Mutt & Jeff (1956)

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too slow and lazy and worst of all: EA have sold us a product that we already own. This mostly sums up why I dislike this parody so much.
That aside, one can’t deny it has many redeeming qualities. No other retail game has achieved such hype and gambling madness in the weeks leading up to its release
